title: Sci-Fi Sans body copy
content:
Hi all,

Looking for some recommendations for a body font for promotional material I am designing for a new play. The play is a science fiction piece, with strong female central characters and feminist themes. I was looking at [Chennai](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dooleytype/chennai/), but some of the characters dont look too well drawn to me, and I was wondering if this was a knock-off of something else, or if there is a better font available in this same vein.

Doesn’t necessarily need to be sans serif, but I think sans may be best to communicate a “futuristic” feel.

All suggestions are appreciated!
author: GraphicFuzz

comments.content:
Or [Gotham Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/typography.com/catalog/gothamrounded/index.html) if you like rounded letters.

One that just occurred to me is [Kautiva](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=kautiva&producttype=TYP&pricemodel=RM%2CRF). It seems to me to have a vaguely futuristic feel to it, although I’m not positive if it feels very feminine.

Other possibilities (thanks to FontBook): [Klavika](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/klavika/), [Stainless](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/stainless/), [Stratum 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/processtype/stratum2/), [Zemestro](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/zemestro/), and [Triplex Sans and Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/triplex/). However, I’m not positive if any of the typefaces that have been mentioned by Lex and I would be terrific for extended reading, though they might be fine for your short promotional text.

Edit: Forgot the link to [Triplex Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20070226074230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/triplex-italic/) — otherwise you might have thought Triplex was italic-less.

Thanks, Lex and Reed.

The Triplex Italic is very unusual, quirky. Could work.
